availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Dabney W. Brown (Hopkins County and Webster County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Hopkins County and Webster County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Elizabeth C. Brown. Father of William Brown, Martha Brown, Martin R. Brown, Sarah C. Brown, Anna Brown, Robert Brown, and Elizabeth N. Brown. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned twelve enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1850. Farmer in Webster County in 1860. Owned twenty-five enslaved persons in Webster County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 132A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 728.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 614-15.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 486A.
"Dabney W. Brown (1802-1864)," Find A Grave, Memorial #97689755, accessed December 15, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/97689755.
